website_summaries.verdict: Very low protein food for cats with a minimum crude protein level of only 8%.
pros: Reasonable price for a low protein food that doesn't require a vet prescription
Has no artificial flavors or colors, so food has safe ingredients
Offers reduced sodium and phosphorus along with the reduced protein to help older cats with digestion
cons: May not be as effective as the prescription formulas
Some cats don't like the taste

customer_reviews.title: My old Cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the food. My very elderly cat has kidney issues, and has gotten very picky about food. He eats this stuff, tolerates it well, and seems to have perked up a bit. That said, the sellers on Amazon are taking advantage. The reason for all the bent cans is they are cutting a full case of 24 in half, so the cans fall out, and then selling it for almost the full case price. Look elsewhere and you should easily find a full case for about the same price as these Amazon listings. Shame, shame on these sellers.
customer_reviews.author: JoeKing

customer_reviews.title: Great product, improved kidney function without need for prescription
customer_reviews.text: My two cats seem to like this and haven't grown tired of it with over a year of use. They refused to eat the Canin or Science Diet versions of the renal prescription canned food which runs about twice the price of the Hi-Tor. In addition, our elderly Himalayan with renal disease had a significant improvement in her kidney function numbers which surprised and pleased her vet. We mix it with half of a three ounce can of Fancy Feast.
customer_reviews.author: Karin G.

customer_reviews.title: Not really prescription diet by veterinarians.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has renal disease and would not eat the prescription cat food that my veterinarian prescribed. I brought a can in & she said it really isn't veterinary described, you need a prescription, but didnt see anything wrong with it. My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ooge

customer_reviews.title: but the cats loved the food
customer_reviews.text: I have only used one can so far, but the cats loved the food. I took a can to the vet's office; she looked it up and said it was not quite as good for kidney control as Hills, but still recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mach1

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: My cat has kidney issues and this food has really helped. She's also a finicky eater but really loves this. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki B

customer_reviews.title: Cats either likes it or hates it
customer_reviews.text: My cat has chronic kidney disease that makes it very hard for her to maintain weight. The price beats prescription cat food (which I don't recommend). This patte style kidney diet food has the perfect ratios of phosphorus and protein to help keep the kidneys from being over-stressed. With that said, I could only get one of my 4 cats to eat this food and she was not the one with renal failure. After 1 week, she refused to eat. I have read mixed reviews about the palatability of Hi-TOR. The general consensus is that your cat either likes it or hates it. Note: The food itself is rather dark and does not smell like traditional cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Willie eat this the best!
customer_reviews.text: Twenty years old cat with kidney problems loves the taste of this over all other brands..... With luck WGW will turn twenty one in September 2020. I still have to keep switching between brands but this is his first pick. Out of the can or blended with a bit more water for him to drink a kitty shake. Seems cats with this problem are picky. He switches between brands and form every few days.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. San Socie

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lesson. This is NOT a 24-can case!
customer_reviews.text: Crud. I thought I'd gotten the 24-can case which I'd ordered before. I feel like I was taken, as when I just looked that day, it said 2-3 weeks, so I grabbed this one by the photo. And now that I look, the one that STATES it's a 24-can case is only $8 more. Expensive lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Mtsnow13

customer_reviews.title: NEO wet cat food
customer_reviews.text: My cat Jinks took to it right away and then kind of got picky with it. I will buy it again to use mixed with another appropriate food for a change. I don't think he would like this every day but then, he does have to be on this diet; like it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes H. Barris

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: First of all Product came on a bag without protection, how can they send the cans without carton board or plastic. This is because the company wants to save money and do it care about quality of the food. After my experience I decided to give this product to my cat because it seems good. However my cat did not even try it since the smell was so bad. Hope it was only a bad batch
customer_reviews.author: themost

customer_reviews.title: My cats actually eat it
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several different brands. My cats will eat this without attitude.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Very poor condition of product
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old cat wouldn't eat it. Was very disappointed by the condition of the shipment, came in a dent free box but inside almost every single can was severely dented, one was open & leaking. No returns. Several reviews mentioned receiving damages product.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi E.

customer_reviews.title: This Neo wet cat food for kidney cats is palatable and well made of reasonable ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My kidney cats like this meaty cat food, which contains a range of various meats. It does contain meat by-products but nonetheless it smells good and has a good texture.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful feline kidney diet food
customer_reviews.text: My cat has chronic kidney disease. This is one of the few “special diet” canned foods he will actually eat. It also does not require a prescription and is cheaper than many of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: pb

customer_reviews.title: It's only good if they'll eat it
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian suggested I switch my pet to a low phosphorus, low protein diet in order to ease stress on his kidneys. I researched for days to find one that met what I thought was the answer to that request. Although it has all the ingredients I could hope for, what good does it do if he won't eat it. This leaves me with a bunch of extremely expensive unopened cans of pet food to take up room in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: sue cowan

customer_reviews.title: Cats enjoy
customer_reviews.text: My cats seem to like the smell and taste, which is great since they are seniors and need this food for their health.
customer_reviews.author: Cristine K.

customer_reviews.title: Likes it most of the time
customer_reviews.text: Our cat with kidney issues loves it 9 out of 10 times. That's pretty good for him
customer_reviews.author: Lief

customer_reviews.title: Cat not a fan
customer_reviews.text: My cat takes a few bites and walks away every time. Cans dented
customer_reviews.author: B.Landers

customer_reviews.title: Price is way too high
customer_reviews.text: Chewy sells a case of Hi-Tor 24 for a little bit more than the 12 pack sold here. It is the exact same product.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: My cat liked it for about a week.
customer_reviews.text: Typical cat, got finicky after a week. Rotating it with other foods.
customer_reviews.author: N. Asher

customer_reviews.title: Low phosphorus means easier on the little guys kidneys
customer_reviews.text: My fellows seemed to like it... it's really about their health, though it is pricey.
customer_reviews.author: festus

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, this isn't a 24 can case!
customer_reviews.text: I did the same thing as a previous reviewer. I was in a rush and saw this was prime and ordered it thinking it was 24 cans and was only 12. The product is great, but I feel like I've been taken. Sure I didn't read the fine print, but it also didn't list the total cans anywhere to easily see.
customer_reviews.author: RileyD

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: My 20 yr old cat has CRF and won’t eat the traditional prescription food, but he loves this
customer_reviews.author: Beth Witt

customer_reviews.title: He eats
customer_reviews.text: Well.. while fat and protein still quite high for a kidney diet. He at least will eat it. By no means his favorite, but if it’s the only thing offered he doesn’t attempt to cover it up like it belongs in his litter box 🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: A 12 pack on Chewy you get a 24 pack for the same price, but my cat didn’t even finish the 12 pack before she decided she didn’t like it
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Very tasty and nice consistency
customer_reviews.text: Now that my oldest cat has CKD, I was pleased to see that NeoTor has improved its taste and consistency since my last CKD cat needed it. My cat is enjoying it and I do alternate with Hills K/D because I think the Hills ingredients are better quality. But Neo-Tor's price and taste are very attractive as an option to mix in with the more traditional prescription diets.
customer_reviews.author: Diana A.

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 years ago my 17 year old cat had no kidney function,I was told I needed to make a decision, so I resurched and found two products that have mad the difference this wet food and aventi KS, so far we’ve go 2.5 years, theses products have gone us more and quality time
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: Double the price of other sellers, but cat food itself is great.
customer_reviews.text: This is great cat foods - our cats love it. BUT this is about double the price of other sellers on amazon. I purchased it without properly checking the number of cans - it was the same price and I was in a hurry. I was surprised when it arrived and I saw how few there were. So do your research and don't be a fool!
customer_reviews.author: rpar003

product_meta.title: Hi-Tor 12 Pack of Veterinary Select Neo Diet for Cats, 5.5 Ounce Cans, for Kidney Health
product_meta.description: The Hi-Tor Neo Diet is specifically formulated for cats requiring a low protein, restricted phosphorus diet to assist in management of renal disease. This formula is highly palatable in order to ensure adequate consumption and caloric intake.
feature_bullets: 12 5.5-ounce cans of Neo Diet for Cats
Formulated to help support your cat's kidney health
Neo canned cat food is made with reduced protein, phosphorous, and sodium
Hi-Tor Veterinary select Special Diets for Cats have been specially formulated for the dietary management of kitty health conditions
When your veterinarian recommends a special diet for your cat's kidney health, Hi-Tor Veterinary Select delivers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
